properties.name: Blue Plate Diner
properties.description: Posted by Journalwebteam The Blue Plate Diner is one of my favourite places in town. I discovered it before anyone else. Me. Read more

properties.name: Chinatown
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamChinatown is one of my favourite places because it is an adventure of exotic sights, tastes and experiences. Read more

properties.name: Commodore Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Journalwebteam The Commodore has a lunch counter with twirly stools, a candy display by the cash register and a Hamilton Beach milkshake mixer. Read more

properties.name: Commonwealth Stadium
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamCommonwealth Stadium is one of my favourite places because of its old-school virtues -- because its name wasn\'t prostituted to some bland financial institution, insurance giant or multinational corporation. Read more

properties.name: Earth's General Store
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamEarth\'s General Store is one of my favourite places in Edmonton. It is one of my favourite places because it reminds me of the angel on my right shoulder. Read more

properties.name: Edmonton City Hall
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamScott McKeen thinks City Hall is so cool that it\'s one of his favourite places in Edmonton. Read more

properties.name: El Rancho
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamThe El Rancho Restaurant, situated next to the much-maligned 118th Avenue, is one of my absolute favourite places in Edmonton. Read more

properties.name: Highlands shops
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamThere is a sauntering, summer afternoon pace to this miniature main street in Highlands, the historic neighbourhood in northeast Edmonton. A short walk to the south, along streets shaded by tall trees and grand homes, is lovely Ada Boulevard. To the north, along similarly appointed streets, is 118th Avenue, once the main eastern route into Edmonton, now a road of grit and promise.Read more

properties.name: Little Italy
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamToday we travel to Little Italy, along 95th Street, north of 107th Avenue. If you\'ve never entered the Italian Centre shop, well, you are poorer for it. If you\'ve never bought a sub sandwich from its deli counter and eaten it in Giovanni Caboto Park -- recently upgraded with a fountain plaza -- you haven\'t lived.Read more

properties.name: Saccomanno's
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamSaccomanno\'s is successful in business despite its bad location, bad location, bad location. Read more

properties.name: Sunbake Pita Bakery
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamThe Sunbake Bakery is in a strip mall, alongside other Arab businesses and cultural organizations. The bakery is run by two brothers, Alex and Geehad Mouallem. They were born in Canada, but spent almost half their life in embattled Lebanon.Read more

properties.name: Wunderbar Hofbrauhaus
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamScooterists beep and wave at each other. Sometimes we go on rides together. Often, we gather at the unofficial scooter watering hole, Wunderbar Hofbrauhaus on Whyte Avenue. Vespa dealer Top Gear, just down the street from the Wunderbar, is scooter central.Read more
